website_summaries.verdict: Excellent option for a flex socket set that costs quite a bit less than other flex sets. Great for simple jobs.
pros: Small collection of sockets, but includes most commonly used metric sizes
Flex design works great for certain types of jobs
Good build quality for the price, other than loose screws in elbow area
Once you have screws locked in, sockets will stand up to frequent usage patterns
cons: Tiny screws included as wrist pins may pop loose over time, causing problems with functionality and use

customer_reviews.title: Used daily for over 6-months in a professional shop.  Whole set is the price of one from snap-on!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used these flex-sockets in a professional shop at least once a day for about 6 months now.. The 10-mm is used easily once a day and makes life a breeze doing oil pans, sneaking right around cross-members, exhaust mounts, craddles and other in-the-way parts. The whole set is cheaper than JUST the 10mm off the tool truck. A+ quality.
customer_reviews.author: Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Handy set...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this set for a little over a year and it continues to hold up and work just fine. Pretty much I use it exclusively for interior / under dash work so there really is not a lot of torque being applied. Zero issues with any of the screws backing out. Well worth the $30 investment..
customer_reviews.author: johnny

customer_reviews.title: Tight.
customer_reviews.text: These sockets seem to be made to a pretty high tolerance. I haven't used them in anger yet but they look like they can do the job they are intended for. I read some complaints about the carrier, which can appear to be a plastic box in the pictures. It's just a block of high density foam with a plastic cover. The foam is pretty durable and if the kit is kept in the original box, it should last forever. So the carrier is just fine to me.
customer_reviews.author: EastMemphis

customer_reviews.title: Recommend this purchase
customer_reviews.text: After 1 year using: *great value for compared cost to others. *neat organized tray. *most used socket is 10mm. It just broke after 1 year. Can't complain too much considering how much I used this particular size. Overall, this is great value. I just ordered a single socket to replace my most used socket (10mm), for $8. Still happy with my purchase due to amount of use i got from this set.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Cochran

customer_reviews.title: Really awesome tools. So glad I purchased.  Better than normal universal.
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic quality. They helped me with a very challenging project where I could not access the bolt heads behind an exhaust manifold hardly at all. These work better than the flexible extension shaft or a simple universal joint because the socket is closer to all the pivots in the universal joint. I used about a 30degree bend, and then an extension and torque wrench.
customer_reviews.author: Rob S.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality 1/4 swivel sockets!
customer_reviews.text: Really like the quality of these 1/4 swivel sockets there well built and the chrome finish looks very nice and has laser etched marking for clear identification. Ive used the metric and sae set of these and they've held up very well. I buy most my tools off the tool truck and have high expectations and these exceeded my expectations for a 30$ set. Defintely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Bodrie belknap

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I work in an Import Repair shop and purchase these because I did not want to spend a fortune on tool truck brands, I.E, Snap-On, Mac, etc. For the money, these are decent. My tools are a mix of Matco, Gearwrench, Snap-On, etc, So I have experience with many tool brands. I stress that for the price, these are a nice set, they seem well made and the chrome plating is uniform. I have only one complaint and that is they only have a one-year warranty. I was a little surprised when I opened them to see such a short warranty. But then again, how much abuse do you plan on giving 1/4" flex sockets?
customer_reviews.author: Wittycow

customer_reviews.title: Loose Set Screw Problem Fixed
customer_reviews.text: Overall a decent set of sockets for an unbeatable price. Definitely not the strongest sockets out there but for ~$36 nothing can come close. Older reviews mention the set screw falling out and the socket falling apart and the solution is to add a dab of locktite however the set I received had locktite already applied so I believe the manufacturer fixed that issue. Definitely recommend if looking for swivel sockets in 1/4 in drive.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good set of sockets
customer_reviews.text: I used these sockets to replace my 99’ F-250 clutch pedal. They worked fine. The only issue is that they come with a foam block holder. It looks nice but I would have preferred a socket rail. No problem as I knew this is how they are sold. Otherwise the sockets work well, I will update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: ncraiderrider

customer_reviews.title: Get into that spot
customer_reviews.text: I've bought these kit and am well pleased with it. They work great for getting into tight spots. I have not broke any yet as they have allowed me to get things snug where a wrench or standard socket cant go. I use them whenever I need something to do the trick. The case is nice to keep them well organized and I have yet to go and reach for one and found it missing. They compress fit in the holder and are easy to get in and out. They have been well worth the money many times over in just saving frustration alone. Nice compact set of 1/4 drive goodness! Makes you say "Awe Yeah"!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Best Deal For 1/4" Drive Flex Sockets!
customer_reviews.text: First thing I noticed is they use Allen head fasteners rather than pins which are not easily replaced if over torqued. These are 1/4" drive not impact sockets!. I'm very happy with these Sockets in my Tool Box.I have 5 years (NAVY) Aircraft, then 35 years as Auto and Truck Mechanic.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but decent set of sockets.
customer_reviews.text: These little sockets seem well made and a pretty decent value. However I purchased this set for a specific project and the sockets were not as much help as I had expected. Just a bit too bulky for this particular application. I’m sure they’ll come in handy for some future projects though.
customer_reviews.author: JakesGarage

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for me.
customer_reviews.text: I'm generally supportive of US manufacturing (these are not), but the whole question is at what point does a price/availability differential make a product inaccessible to a whole lot of people? These have worked great for me, and the price was tolerable, and they showed up the day (well, really, the day after, but that's better than the alternatives) I needed them.
customer_reviews.author: JEM

customer_reviews.title: At full price these are more then a great buy, but at the time of my purchase ...
customer_reviews.text: At full price these are more then a great buy, but at the time of my purchase both Metric and Inch sets were further discounted and went under $30. Some of the research I've done points out the screws on the sockets can start to come free and too just add tread locker. I have not had this issue so far with the metric set which gets used the most. The foam trays provided are great I just stack the Metric and Inch sets and they don't take up much space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and precise engineering. Tough flex sockets.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice set of Taiwan made flex sockets. Fit and finish is precise to fit bolt heads. Comes in organizer foam case. Used with a set of wobble extensions make working at awkward angles so much easier. A little hard to read the printed socket size but if they are kept in their case then selection is easy. Their is an Astro one year limited warranty for replacement socket should one break.
customer_reviews.author: scsib

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: Solid small flex sockets...just remember to loctite the swivel pins before extended use, and using them with an impact driver/gun will make these pins rattle out and the socket fall apart. So they need regular attention.
customer_reviews.author: James Whalley

customer_reviews.title: Work great.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a 1/4” swivel socket for work but ended up buying this whole set since it was so cheap. Used them quite a bit and haven’t had any issues at all. Much cheaper alternative to the tool trucks without sacrificing quality.
customer_reviews.author: mdw

customer_reviews.title: These work great in tight places.
customer_reviews.text: These little jobbers are a godsend in some situations. With the swivel already part of the socket, it takes one moving part out and puts more torque unto the fastener.
customer_reviews.author: James T.

customer_reviews.title: They’re floppy
customer_reviews.text: My complaint with these is that the joint is too loose. If you’re trying to get to a hard to reach bolt it flops around too much and is hard to get it placed where you want. The actual quality seems good, but wish it wasn’t so “floppy”.
customer_reviews.author: Kaytie

customer_reviews.title: Arrived quickly looks well built  will do the job
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly , they look like they're I'll do what I need them to do. Thank you and I will buy from you again. Sincerely John W.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Work well and good value.
customer_reviews.text: Good set. I have other sets of this brand. They work well and are strong. The Allen keyed screws make them easy to angle. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: bmf143

customer_reviews.title: Used these to change my thermostat and a cam position ...
customer_reviews.text: Used these to change my thermostat and a cam position sensor. The bolts were at slightly awkward angles, and with these, it was absolutely no problem getting them out. It’s a must have for anyone who works on cars. Little bolts all over the place at odd angles stand no chance with these in your arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile Socket Set
customer_reviews.text: I've had these come in handy a lot since I got them. I picked them up because of a recommendation from RealTechReview's YouTube channel. The quality is not bad at all; the chrome job is pretty good, and they fit their intended fasteners well. (10mm socket pictures for reference)
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Appear to be Well Made
customer_reviews.text: I bought a similar set of 1/4" drive flex metric sockets 30 years ago for about $80 - a well known US brand. They have been invaluable for working in tight areas. I was curious about the quality of this set and after reading a few reviews I ordered both the metric and SAE sets. I am impressed with the quality appearance. The universal joint is fastened with a hex head screw which can be tightened. I like the size labeling which is etched. Also, the metric set goes up to 15 mm which is a size I have never seen in a 1/4" drive universal. Cannot comment on durability yet.
customer_reviews.author: Elderly Person

customer_reviews.title: decently priced compared to other places that sell this brand
customer_reviews.text: so far so good. the joints arent as stiff as I'd prefer but they function and arent to sloppy. metal is sturdy and is showing no signs of weakening or breaking
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Astro 7412 1/4-Inch Drive Flex Socket Set, 6 Point - Metric
customer_reviews.text: They appear to be of good quality, a little deeper then I am used to (snapon person) but for home use that should not be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: J&J

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for the price.
customer_reviews.text: They are very good quality at a good price. I don't see that they are assembled with screws rather than pins a negative. I took the advice of others and used Loctite as soon as I got them. I used the 290 wicking grade so I did not have to disassemble them. Just a tiny drop from the tip of a toothpick on each threaded end. The case is pretty much worthless. I would rather they just supply a rail. Otherwise I like them so far.
customer_reviews.author: JTF

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure how they’ll be long term, but I’m a hobbyist/ DIY, I don’t make my living with tools. These fit the need for a specific project and at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: A. Luptak

customer_reviews.title: Very nice full set
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the quality for the money. I use the 8mm and 10mm all the time the joint is still nice and tight. Another reason this set gets 5 stars plus is that it's a full 1/4 set from 5 and 5.5 to 15mm.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: nice but i think it could be improved
customer_reviews.text: good quality works nice but swivelle swings freely i think it should be a little tighter but that is my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: william wood

customer_reviews.title: so much better than the tool truck (SNAP OFF)
customer_reviews.text: the soft case is prefect and quality is top notch, so much better than the tool truck (SNAP OFF). Order the set, you will not be disappointed! This is coming from a 5+ year experienced European automotive technician, and i use them daily.
customer_reviews.author: Mikayla

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but socket section is very tall
customer_reviews.text: Good for the money, but they are too tall for getting into places in European cars. Unfortunately the snap on and Mac tools will reach places these will not and the cost is 10 times higher. These will probably work for Asian and us auto mechanics just fine though. Worth having either way at the price.
customer_reviews.author: masonh

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought the set to carry in my Polaris Ranger as an addition to my 300 piece tool set I always carry whether in the desert or in the mountains with snow tracks on.
customer_reviews.author: NInedogs

customer_reviews.title: Nice Set!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my Dad and he is really happy with the quality. Not the kind of set you can just pick up at the hardware store in this town.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: Used every day for months, no issues. Comes with a warrant any a very nice organizer. Virtually identical to high end versions Co workers snap on, those are just a little bit more shallow but hi uses mine sometimes too so that says something
customer_reviews.author: Jake Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: nice finish
customer_reviews.text: Nice addition to the toolbox. Nice finish, and they are clearly marked ( etched) for size. Looks like good value for the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Blacksmith7

customer_reviews.title: I never ever overspend
customer_reviews.text: Looks better than tools costing 400% more and feels great , and also works great
customer_reviews.author: Douglas H.

customer_reviews.title: Can not live without it...
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic set. It is always in use. Cannot go wrong purchasing this set. Thank you Vendor and Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: CubanoLibre

customer_reviews.title: Quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Great for a hard to reach bolt on a Ford 4.0 thermostat housing. Good fit on both the bolt and the ratchet, and they seem to be well made. They have just enough resistance to hold the angle you set them at to reach the bolt, instead of flopping away which is important, since if you are using these, you are in a tough to reach spot.
customer_reviews.author: Player Two

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: I bought these sockets with the intent of using them in those tight places which are highly inaccessible. They do get to most things, which is great. However, I found that the upper portion (socket half) is a tad too deep, rendering it incapable of reaching the tightest spots. So consider that when buying these, since the price is really good.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Ranchois

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: Good but not great. They work but with tools, you get what you pay for. These are no exception.
customer_reviews.author: Erick K

customer_reviews.title: Great tools, even if they cost $150
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I didn’t want to spend the money on a snapon set. They are great for the money. I’ve used the 8mm a bunch and it still works like it just came out of the box. 10/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Elise

customer_reviews.title: Good set for the money
customer_reviews.text: These are good to fair quality 1/4 inch swivels. The sockets are held together by little Allen wrench screws instead of the roll pins the other brands use. They come loose from time to time and have to be tightened. Not a big deal but worth mentioning in a review. They hold up pretty good but if you really have to put a lot of force to them they will break. However I believe these are the best 1/4 inch swivels in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Kern

customer_reviews.title: Great set for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great price and the sizes to get in tight places
customer_reviews.author: Homer Comeaux

customer_reviews.title: haven't used them much yet but they seem very good so far
customer_reviews.text: look and fell very good really good for the money
customer_reviews.author: 859 petersburg

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: For those hard to reach fasteners... Very useful. Pays for itself
customer_reviews.author: Ousmane

customer_reviews.title: I have never broken one, worn one out, my problem is losing them
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about the brand name not being as recognizable as other brands, but have no fear about that. Case works well, Sockets work well, no issues, have ordered 3 sets of these now over the last few years, due to me losing certain most used sockets, never worn one out. they do the job for me!
customer_reviews.author: bob lemley

customer_reviews.title: A great value
customer_reviews.text: These universal sockets come packaged in a neatly organized two-color foam tray which has the sizes marked into it. The size markings also appear to be laser-etched into the sockets rather than stamped. The quality of materials is very good and the sockets are put together using screws instead of pressed-in pins. The screws are easily tightened should they loosen over time. Certain sizes are a little longer than my professional grade set, but overall these are a great value!
customer_reviews.author: toolshopper

customer_reviews.title: Incredible flex socket set
customer_reviews.text: Very nice set of flex socket! Quality is excellent. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Capt'n Dave

customer_reviews.title: Incredible value
customer_reviews.text: After much research and pricing there isn't anything else out there that compares to the performance/price ratio. Performs well and for the price can't be beat. You can't even buy a single socket off a tool truck for the price of this whole set. When compared with one of the tool truck sockets, the size is nearly identical. A big concern for buying inexpensive tools is that the size is almost unusable for the application in which you desire to use them. Also has a good storage case. Nothing negative to say so far.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Better off passing on this one if you want to loctite the screw pins
customer_reviews.text: I bought them knowing the hex screws come loose. They use a 1/16" hex and well over half of them are misshapen from the manufacturer's installation. They are clearly overdriven and over torqued to "set" them in. The steel used for the hex screws isn't a high enough grade to support removing to apply loctite. Even Bondhus tips won't grab. Save a little more for a higher grade set. That's what I wish I'd done.
customer_reviews.author: David Kopp

customer_reviews.title: YES!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Holy cow was this a good buy. Almost $400 cheaper than the cheapest truck brand and the quality is great. I use mine almost daily at a European automotive repair shop with ZERO problems. I recommend you buy this set and get everybody you know to buy a set.
customer_reviews.author: SlicedBeard

customer_reviews.title: Good set
customer_reviews.text: I bought the SAE and MM set. I've used the MM a few times and they worked great. I'd rather grab a socket then a universal and a socket.
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: what to know
customer_reviews.text: the size on the side of tool is lazer printed over time will rub off and you will not know your size of tool
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for tight spaces
customer_reviews.text: Used this many times already. Seems well made and the joints aren't sloppy. Love how convenient it is.
customer_reviews.author: Hi

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: Good set the only thing is the set screws are loose but it's a easy fix with some thread lock
customer_reviews.author: azdoc

customer_reviews.title: These flex sockets work great!! Be advised that when you get the ...
customer_reviews.text: These flex sockets work great !! Be advised that when you get the sockets take the time to put loctite on the screws. They will come loose if you don't and are very likely to get lost rendering the tool useless.
customer_reviews.author: James G. Asbell

customer_reviews.title: At full price these are more then a great buy, but at the time of my purchase ...
customer_reviews.text: At full price these are more then a great buy, but at the time of my purchase both Metric and Inch sets went under $30. Some of the research I've done points out the screws on sockets can start to come free and too just add tread locker. I have not had this issue so far with the metric set which gets used the most. The foam trays provided are great I just stack the Metric and Inch sets and they don't take up much space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Kit
customer_reviews.text: This kit comes in a soft foam case so it's also great for storage in the box.Great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Makuzak

customer_reviews.title: NICE SET
customer_reviews.text: This socket set showed up on time. I like the complete numbers all the way to 15mm.They are nicely made and in a foam case. I did read the reviews and took the advise to made sure the screws were tight, found a couple loose, no big deal. The numbers are small to read,there is plenty of room on the other side of the socket to put a large number. All and all I would recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: I recommend pulling them all out and applying Loctite/threadlocker to them ...
customer_reviews.text: used with 1/4 inch electric impact gun, holds up well, almost a year of near everday use with sizes 8,10,11, 13. no breakages yet. when using with impact, though screws tend to back out. I recommend pulling them all out and applying Loctite/threadlocker to them before use.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I found these universal sockets a good value for car dash work. I would recomend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great set for the $$$
customer_reviews.text: As a full time tech i don't know how anyone can get away without a 1/4" swivel socket set. These things are a great value for the money and have held up just as long as the snap-on set my coworker uses. love the complete range from 5mm up to 15mm without skipping sizes, including having a 5.5mm!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These things are excellent. Using on a high torque milwaukee 1/4 electric ...
customer_reviews.text: These things are excellent. Using on a high torque milwaukee 1/4 electric impact daily. These are seeing consistent, daily professional use and ive had ZERO trouble with them. Highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: A necessity for any mechanics box
customer_reviews.text: These come in handy on really tight spots. I used them 5 minutes after receiving them in the mail on a timing belt job. The only suggestion I have, is that the length of the actual socket is the normal size or a typically 1/4 shallow drive set.Id prefer it they were a tad more shallow like the snap-on version.
customer_reviews.author: hunter guilbeaux

customer_reviews.title: Great Fex Sockets
customer_reviews.text: These are the best of the flex sockets I have seen over my 50 yrs working on equipment. I decided to buy the 1/4" SAE and MM, also the 3/8" SAE and MM
customer_reviews.author: Bill or sparkey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Set
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good quality socket set. I think they are as good or better than most of the ones Ive seen. Someone said they are not heavy duty enough. I disagree and find these to be excellent quality. They are not loose or sloppy like many I have used. I use them professionally and find them very good. They are small sockets and are not designed to have 150lbs of torque on them. They work perfectly for what they are designed for.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Robles

customer_reviews.title: good finish but I don
customer_reviews.text: Seem to be made well enough, good finish but I don;t like the small allen screws holding them together. Will see if they loosen over time.
customer_reviews.author: Nomad

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Only reason I put 4 stars on durability is that I’ve only had them a month. The 10mm has had extensive use to say the least and still operates just fine. My buddies at work are jealous of the set and plan to buy their own from these guys! Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Just a boat mechanic

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool Set. Only 1 year warranty
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality and performance. Only gripe I have is that it only has a 1 year warranty. No problems with use or functionality. Seems like solid quality, but they should back up their tools for life. The size marking next to the holder slot is a plus because the toll size etching is small and could wear off after use.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard D. H

customer_reviews.title: they work and a fourth the price
customer_reviews.text: Sockets and good quality but cheap enough so if you lose one you not screaming
customer_reviews.author: Stevesfatmetal

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: Needed one size to get to one bolt on valve cover. Held up well. Did the job.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H.

customer_reviews.title: Work great. Great price!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had anything but good things to say about these so far.
customer_reviews.author: sock

customer_reviews.title: Good quality low profile...
customer_reviews.text: These are as good as Snap On at $450.00 less! They even came in a foam storage container for the tool box. I highly recommend these...
customer_reviews.author: Scott Coghill

customer_reviews.title: Lose joints, frustrating to use.
customer_reviews.text: Too lose to be useful, frustrating to use. you get what you paid for I guess.
customer_reviews.author: sam smith

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy for a good bargain.
customer_reviews.text: For the price of these sockets you might think they would break! I bought these to work on my diesel 6.0L which needs the swivel 10mm and 12mm A LOT! Solid tools and would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool Set. Only 1 year warranty
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality and performance. Only gripe I have is that it only has a 1 year warranty. No problems with use or functionality. Seems like solid quality, but they should back up their tools for life. The size marking next to the holder slot is a plus because the toll size etching is small and could wear off after use.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard D. H

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny just for the 5. 5mm one ...
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny just for the 5.5mm one. Now you can remove GM blower resistors with 60% less hatred and anger. Wrap a piece of electrical tape around the joint if it's too floppy.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Giesbrecht

customer_reviews.title: These flex sockets work great!! Be advised that when you get the ...
customer_reviews.text: These flex sockets work great !! Be advised that when you get the sockets take the time to put loctite on the screws. They will come loose if you don't and are very likely to get lost rendering the tool useless.
customer_reviews.author: James G. Asbell

customer_reviews.title: Can't get a better set on 1/4 in wobbles for under 20$
customer_reviews.text: Can't get a better set on 1/4 in wobbles for under 20$. Some reviews stated there screws were loose. Mine were all tight and haven't came loose. But as anything screwed together I check them every so often
customer_reviews.author: jeffcg

customer_reviews.title: It was on pretty tight and I gave it the beans to loosen ...
customer_reviews.text: Handy little set, I used the 15mm to break loose a distributor hold down bolt on a firebird. It was on pretty tight and I gave it the beans to loosen it. Socket held up great and made the job much easier. Can't wait to put the rest of them to use!
customer_reviews.author: Nick Perrin

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: Looks to be good quality and worksmanship. All joints are tight and screws appear to be lock-tighted in place
customer_reviews.author: RichardHWeeks

customer_reviews.title: I have not had a problem with my set.
customer_reviews.text: It's been about a year now and I have not had a problem with my set. I don't use these to torque bolts down and I don't use them everyday, so I would not say they are junk. They have always worked fine for me. I've gotten my monies worth.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: So far,so good! Have only used on size so far,made the job much easier
customer_reviews.author: David R Silva

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are surprisingly strong. I use them with my 1/4 impact driver and none have broken
customer_reviews.author: T-rav

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t recommend them
customer_reviews.text: Not a smooth action swivel so If your at even a slight angle when your trying to tighten down they flop right off the bolt time and time again very frustrating! They are holding up ok though so that’s a positive
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: works!
customer_reviews.text: For the husband to use at work and he's a happy camper. 'Nuff said!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Very good flex sockets. They work just like the big name brands a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Item was exactly as described by the seller Very good product and value
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely neccessary if you are working on Porsche or Audi ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely neccessary if you are working on Porsche or Audi vehicles, and capable of making jobs on more conventional automobiles far more convenient (i.e. valve cover jobs on Buick V6 engines).
customer_reviews.author: AerialBadgerRelease

customer_reviews.title: astro flex sockets
customer_reviews.text: Great quality for the price. Purchased these cause Sears no longer makes a comparable set. Lower price but same quality as Sears and the tool trucks. I use these as a professional auto technician and haven't had any issues. One of my co-workers even bought a set because he was impressed with the quality. He hasn't had issues with them either. Definately worth the money in my book. This set even has a 15mm, which most sets don't have.
customer_reviews.author: ifgshooter

customer_reviews.title: Great price for good quality
customer_reviews.text: Very well made for the bucks. The size marking are a bit faint and the joints are somewhat loose but very usable. I didn't have any failures of the pins as has been suggested in other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: TomC

customer_reviews.title: Not holding firm
customer_reviews.text: The problem it wont hold firm on its set position ,its a miss or hit job mostly reaching narrow deep upward position.
customer_reviews.author: Losmarlon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing for the price... if you are advanced enough to use flex drive. I got some off the truck that are way better for 10x the price these go unused now but we're good to have when I couldn't afford the truck ones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice set at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Nice set at a great price. Because of the light weight nature of 1/4 drive, I would even use them professionally.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Adams

customer_reviews.title: 4 triton mop (module on plug) easy to get on and off
customer_reviews.text: makes getting at my 5.4 triton mop (module on plug) easy to get on and off.
customer_reviews.author: butterat

customer_reviews.title: eeeehhhhhhh, not so good
customer_reviews.text: IDK about their other tools, but this set let me down pretty hard!!! the pins broke within a few uses to a couple dozen uses. and that's not just one, but about half of them. But, for the price... ehhh.... not happy with it
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good buy sockets look great and work great as well a lot less than what snap on wanted
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: items is of mid grade, will fall of extension or ratched
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Good socket set
customer_reviews.text: I used this to change my oil pan gasket, really helpful
customer_reviews.author: Danijela

product_meta.title: Astro Pneumatic Tool 7412 12-Piece 1/4" Drive Flex Socket Set - 6 Point - Metric
product_meta.description:
Size:MetricFROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Astro Pneumatic 7412 - 12 -Piece. 1/4-Inch Dr. 6 Pt. Metric Flex Socket Set features surface drive technology that grips fasteners on the flats for greater torque transmission without rounding. Flexible joints make it versatile for hard to reach fasteners. Full polish finish for a crisp look. Set includes: 5mm, 5.5mm, 6mm, 7mm, 8mm, 9mm, 10mm, 11mm, 12mm, 13mm, 14mm, 15mm Flex Sockets.
feature_bullets: Angle and articulate to access tight spaces while maintaining a solid grip on the fastener
